hook.text: A song goes viral not because it's the best â€” but because enough people already listened to it.

buildup.text: The bandwagon effect is our tendency to adopt beliefs and behaviors proportional to others doing the same.

discovery.text: In an experiment, artificial download counts made random songs chart-toppers. Popularity created more popularity.

twist.text: This creates winner-take-all dynamics. Early momentum matters more than actual quality.

climax.text: Political polls, bestseller lists, and trending hashtags all trigger bandwagon cascades that self-reinforce.

punchline.text: The popular choice isn't always the best. It's the first.

quiz.question: What drives the bandwagon effect?
options: People adopting behaviors others have adopted
